member.name: T:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.BcdrFxCop
member.summary: IMPORTANT: This class is an exact copy of the common infra FxCop class. It is only supposed to be used for external facing dlls that require strong-name signing, because common infra dlls aren't strong-name signed. All internal dlls should still reference the common infra FxCop to be consistent with the rest of the internal components from other teams.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.StreamJournal.TransferChunkSize
member.summary: Size for one saved transfer instance in the journal stream. To reuse space transfer instances in journal stream to avoid occupy too much disks when transferring large amount of files, it allocates fixed size spaces for one transfer instance in the stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.StreamJournal.TransferItemContentSize
member.summary: For each transfer instance, it saves the transfer object itself and the transfer's ProgressTracker in the journal. This is size to allocated for the transfer object itself.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.StreamJournal.JournalHeadOffset
member.summary: It keeps a list of used transfer chunks and a list free transfers in the journal stream, journal head keeps the heads and tails for these two lists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.StreamJournal.ContentOffset
member.summary: Offset in stream for the beginning to persistant transfer instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.StreamJournal.baseTransfer
member.summary: In the journal, it only allows one base transfer, which means user can only add one transfer to the checkpoint using stream journal. A base transfer can be a SingleObjectTransfer or a MultipleObjectTransfer, if it's a MultipleObjectTransfer, there could be multiple subtransfers, each subtransfer is a SingleObjectTransfer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferControllers.RangeBasedReader.MinimumNoDataRangeSize
member.summary: Minimum size of empty range, the empty ranges which is smaller than this size will be merged to the adjacent range with data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferControllers.RangeBasedReader.PrepareToGetRanges
member.summary: It might fail to get large ranges list from storage. This method is to split the whole file to spans of 148MB to get ranges. In restartable, we only need to get ranges for chunks in TransferWindow and after TransferEntryOffset in check point. In TransferWindow, there might be some chunks adjacent to TransferEntryOffset, so this method will first merge these chunks into TransferEntryOffset; Then in remained chunks in the TransferWindow, it's very possible that ranges of several chunks can be got in one 148MB span. To avoid sending too many get ranges requests, this method will merge the chunks to 148MB spans.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the controller has work available or not for the calling code. If HasWork is false, while IsFinished is also false this indicates that there are currently still active async tasks running. The caller should continue checking if this controller HasWork available later; once the currently active async tasks are done HasWork will change to True, or IsFinished will be set to True.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferEnumerators.AzureNameResolver.translateDelimitersRegexFormat
member.summary:
Regular expression string format for replacing delimiters that we consider as directory separators:
Translate delimiters to '\' if it is: not the first or the last character in the file name and not following another delimiter /folder1//folder2/ with '/' as delimiter gets translated to: /folder1\/folder2/ .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferEnumerators.AzureNameResolver.translateDelimitersRegex
member.summary:
Regular expression for replacing delimiters that we consider as directory separators:
Translate delimiters to '\' if it is: not the first or the last character in the file name and not following another delimiter /folder1//folder2/ with '/' as delimiter gets translated to: /folder1\/folder2/ .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferEnumerators.EnumerateDirectoryHelper.EnumerateFiles(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IO.SearchOption,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the names of files (including their paths) in the specified directory that match the specified search pattern, using a value to determine whether to search subdirectories. Folder permission will be checked for those folders containing found files. Difference with Directory.GetFiles/EnumerateFiles: Junctions and folders not accessible will be ignored.
member.param: The directory to search.

The search string to match against the names of files in path. The parameter cannot end in two periods ("..") or contain two periods ("..") followed by DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar, nor can it contain any of the characters in InvalidPathChars.
Enumerate from this file, file(s) before this and this file won't be returned.

One of the values of the SearchOption enumeration that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories. The default value is TopDirectoryOnly.
CancellationToken to cancel the method.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of file names in the directory specified by path and that match searchPattern and searchOption.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants
member.summary: Constants for use with the transfer classes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxBlockSize
member.summary: Stores the max block size, 100MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.DefaultBlockSize
member.summary: Default block size, 4MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.DefaultMemoryChunkSize
member.summary: Default memory chunk size of memory pool, 4MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxFilePathLength
member.summary: Maximum windows file path is 260 characters, including a terminating NULL characters. This leaves 259 useable characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxRelativePathLength
member.summary: Maximum relative path length which can be accepted. During enumeration, if the relative path length to the transfer root directory is large than this value, it could potentially cause stream journal corrupted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.CacheSizeMultiplierInByte
member.summary: Define cache size for one parallel operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.DefaultContainerName
member.summary: Default to root container name if none is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MinBlockSize
member.summary: Minimum block size, 4MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxAppendBlobFileSize
member.summary: Stores the max append blob file size, 50000 * 4M.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxBlockBlobFileSize
member.summary: Stores the max block blob file size, 50000 * 100M.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxCloudFileSize
member.summary: Stores the max cloud file size, 1TB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MaxCountInTransferWindow
member.summary: Max transfer window size. There can be multiple threads to transfer a file, and we need to record transfer window and have constant length for a transfer entry record in restart journal, so set a limitation for transfer window here.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.PageRangesSpanSize
member.summary: Length to get page ranges in one request. In blog http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2012/03/26/getting-the-page-ranges-of-a-large-page-blob-in-segments.aspx, it says that it's safe to get page ranges of 150M in one request. We use 148MB which is multiples of 4MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.FileRangeSpanSize
member.summary: Length to get file ranges in one request. Use the same number as page blob for now because cloud file leverages page blob in implementation. TODO: update this number when doc for cloud file is available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MemoryCacheMultiplier
member.summary: Percentage of available we'll try to use for our memory cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MemoryCacheMaximum
member.summary: Maximum amount of memory to use for our memory cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.MemoryManagerCellsMaximum
member.summary: Maximum amount of cells in memory manager.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.CopySASLifeTimeInMinutes
member.summary: The life time in minutes of SAS auto generated for asynchronous copy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.CopyStatusRefreshMinWaitTimeInMilliseconds
member.summary: The time in milliseconds to wait to refresh copy status for asynchronous copy. In order to avoid refreshing the status too aggressively for large copy job and meanwhile provide a timely update for small copy job, the wait time increases from 0.1 second to 5 seconds gradually and remains 5 seconds afterwards.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.CopyApproachingFinishThresholdInBytes
member.summary: Asynchronous copy decreases status refresh wait time to 0.1s if there's less than 500 MB data to copy in order to detect the job completion in time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.ListSegmentLengthMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier to calculate number of entries listed in one segment. Formula is: Concurrency * ListSegmentLengthMultiplier.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.Constants.UserAgentProductName
member.summary: The product name used in UserAgent header.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.CopyDirectoryOptions
member.summary: Represents a set of options that may be specified for copy directory operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.CopyDirectoryOptions.BlobType
member.summary: Gets or sets type of destination blob. This option takes effect only when copying from non Azure blob storage to Azure blob storage. If blob type is not specified, BlockBlob is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.CopyDirectoryOptions.IncludeSnapshots
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to include snapshots when copying from Azure blob storage.
member.remarks: If this flag is set to true, snapshots of the source blob will be copied to destination as separate files. Given a source blob name in the form of "x.y", where 'x' is the file name without extension and 'y' is the file name extension, the destination file name of blob snapshot is formatted as "x (%snapshot_time_stamp%).y".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.CopyDirectoryOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets a char that indicates the delimiter character used to delimit virtual directories in a blob name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DirectoryOptions
member.summary: Represents a set of options that may be specified for directory transfer operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DirectoryOptions.SearchPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that will be used to match against the names of files.
member.remarks:
Behavior of SearchPattern match varies for different source directory types and setting of Recursive: When source is local directory path, SearchPattern is matched against source file name as standard wildcards. If recuresive is set to false, only files directly under the source directory will be matched. Otherwise, all files in the sub-directory will be matched as well.
When source is Azure blob directory, if recuresive is set to true, SearchPattern is matched against source blob as name prefix. Otherwise, only Azure blob with the exact name specified by SearchPattern will be matched.
When source is Azure file directory, if recursive is set to true, SearchPattern is not supported. Otherwise, only Azure file with the exact name specified by SearchPattern will be matched.
If SearchPattern is not specified, "*.*" will be used for local directory source while empty string for Azure blob/file directory. So please either specify the Search Pattern or set Recursive to true when source is Azure blob/file directory, otherwise, no blob/file will be matched.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DirectoryOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that indicates whether to include subdirectories when doing a directory transfer operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DownloadDirectoryOptions
member.summary: Represents a set of options that may be specified for download directory operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DownloadDirectoryOptions.DisableContentMD5Validation
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether to validate content MD5 or not when reading data from the source object. If set to true, source object content MD5 will be validated; otherwise, source object content MD5 will not be validated. If not specified, it defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DownloadDirectoryOptions.IncludeSnapshots
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to include snapshots when downloading from Azure blob storage.
member.remarks: If this flag is set to true, snapshots of the source blob will be copied to destination as separate files. Given a source blob name in the form of "x.y", where 'x' is the file name without extension and 'y' is the file name extension, the destination file name of blob snapshot is formatted as "x (%snapshot_time_stamp%).y".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.DownloadDirectoryOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets a char that indicates the delimiter character used to delimit virtual directories in a blob name.

member.value: How many work items to process concurrently.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AzureStack.Backup.Storage.DataMovement.TransferConfigurations.BlockSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the BlockSize to use for Windows Azure Storage transfers to block blob(s). It must be between 4MB and 100MB and be multiple of 4MB.
Currently, the max block count of a block blob is limited to 50000. When transfering a big file and the BlockSize provided is smaller than the minimum value - (size/50000), it'll be reset to a value which is greater than the minimum value and multiple of 4MB for this file.
member.value: BlockSize to use for Windows Azure Storage transfers.

Here, only need to keep LeaseId in the customer condition for the following operations.

To specify whether have already verified the custom access condition against the blob.
